name: Marianne L. Elbertson
summary: Senior Food Defense Analyst with extensive experience in public relations, strategic planning, program development, and cross-agency outreach. Skilled at building networks, leading initiatives, influencing senior leadership, and delivering results in dynamic, budget-constrained environments. Experienced in creating and managing outreach materials, media relations, training, and policy guidance to address global food defense challenges.

experience.title: Senior Food Defense Analyst
experience.description: Serve as Subject Matter Expert and Detailee to the FBI on countermeasures to prevent intentional contamination of the food supply. Lead interagency teams for designing and conducting training and outreach to foreign governments, academia, and industry. Act as communications liaison for internal teams. Initiated integration of the FBI as a partner, resulting in law enforcement elements and funding added to the initiative. Managed international outreach under budget constraints, developed long-range objectives, and attracted additional federal partners. Developed strategy, proposals, and supporting materials including budgets. Led policy and strategy work on global supply chain vulnerabilities and secured significant funding for major international initiatives. Presented briefings to intelligence, law enforcement, foreign, academic, and industry officials, and congressional staff.

experience.title: Public Affairs Specialist
experience.description: Conducted public relations activities to promote effective communications with media and constituent groups. Managed preparation and publication of weekly newsletter. Served as agency lead representative to develop emergency communication protocols used department-wide for media communications during significant incidents. Coordinated and supported agency communication activities and constituent outreach campaigns. Responded to constituent and media inquiries; established relationships with stakeholders; supported speech writing, press releases, talking points, presentations, and responses to congressional inquiries.

experience.title: Government Relations Associate
experience.description: Assisted Director and Manager of Regulatory Affairs in promoting and advancing company interests in federal government issues. Influenced legislation and regulations by engaging government officials. Analyzed potential legislation and coordinated research projects to support company goals.

experience.title: Public Affairs Specialist
experience.description: Responded to media inquiries, researched and wrote talking points, issue papers, news releases, fact sheets, and reports. Interacted with member-company executives and representatives to support organizational mission and goals.

experience.title: Assistant Publicist
experience.description: Researched and pitched story ideas and tour publicity for clients. Drafted media relations materials, organized shoots, and coordinated media campaigns. Built and maintained relationships with regional and national media to secure coverage.

experience.title: Administrative Assistant
experience.description: Prepared documents for purchasers of syndicated television packages; maintained accuracy and on-time completion of assignments.
